reviewText: Steel Cage Match Triple H VS Mankind: The commentating for this match was horrible. I never understood why some cage matches have refs in the cage and other do not. They explained because it was a no disqualification match but isn't every cage match a no dq match? Anyway, this was a great match even with the outside interference from Chyna. The ending was botched but it still looked good.Goldust VS Brian Pillman: I too remember this feud but this match wasn't so great. Pillman was living the last few months of his life and he was no longer the wrestler he once was. It's really sad to watch after learning this.LOD VS Godwinns: Summerslam did have some great tag team matches. The ending was weak but I still enjoyed the match overall.The had a million dollar contest with that nerd Todd Pettingmen (or however you spell it) and a very sexy Sunny and Sable. Holy god, Sunny was hot back in the day. It's worth buying the event to see her outfit.Ken Shamrock VS British Bulldog: I forgot how much I liked Ken Shamrock. This was a good match but the ending sucked. The aftermath was brutal and probably one of the most violent beatdowns in WWF history.DOA VS Los Boricuas: Yawn. Stupid match that could have been saved for Raw or the opener instead of near the main event.Owen Hart VS Stone Cold: A great match despite the botched finish. The weakest roll up in the history of the WWF, but I understand it was because of Austin's broken neck.Bret Hart VS Undertaker with HBK as the guest ref: A great match that would set up two feuds for the next few years.Overall, this PPV was a changing of the guards of WWF. They'd soon get away from kid friendly wrestler to D-X. Bret Hart says in his book he'll never forgive Hunter and Shawn for ruining pro wrestling. I dont know if I agree but wrestling hasn't been the same for almost ten years. I believe the internet ruined pro wrestling, the story lines, and the lack of enthusiasm fpr fans. The internet will tell you what will happen at events, the stories are always the same and lack anything new. Now check out Summerslam 1988 compared to Summerslam 2008. The fans would cheer for anything back in 88 and today fans could careless about midcare matches and just cheer for the bigger stars. I prefer WWF from 1984 till they dropped the F. Some might say once they dropped the F, they started to suck. Well I cannot argue with that because for the most part, it's true. It also doesnt help that there is no other company pushing WWE to make them compete better. It's also a sad event to watch because so many wrestlers in this event have passed on-Pillman, Hawk, Crush, Bulldog, and Owen Hart have all passed on to the big ring in the sky. It's so sad to think of all the wrestlers who have left us so young. This event is probably the last clean PPV but dont get me wrong, I loved Stone Cold, The Rock, and D-X. 1999 was the greatest year for promos and interviews.
Title: WWF SummerSlam 1997 VHS

reviewText: Aww, another old WWF tape that I found in my set as this was during the time that United States vs. Canada feud was in full effect as Bret Hart was leading his Hart Foundation members to lead an anti-American crusade against the Americans that turned on Bret at WrestleMania. To hype up this event even more, each match that involved the Hart Foundation had a special stipulation that would effect that wrestler while at the same time, the main event sparked one of the best feuds in WWF history.Steel Cage Match: Mankind vs Hunter Hearst Helmsley. This was their third match in their series of PPV matches in a row & just like their previous two encounters, this one really delivered. It's wasn't a bloody cage match but it was full of high impact moves with moments like HHH suplexing Mankind off the top of the cage, Mankind taking a sick shot to the head with the cage door at the hands of Chyna with even Chyna tasting the cage at one point & the highlight of the match where Mankind leaped off the top of the cage to deliver an elbow to Hunter to win the match.Goldust vs Brian Pillman. The first match involving the Hart Foundation with the stipulation to this one being that if Pillman lost the match, he would have to wear a dress on RAW the next night. Besides that, this was an average but nothing special match with even a botched ending on top of it. They would have a better match a month later at Ground Zero.Legion of Doom vs Godwinns. This was another match that was average & watchable but this was nothing special past that fact.WWF European Champion The British Bulldog vs Ken Shamrock. If Bulldog didn't win this match, then he would be forced to eat dog food. This didn't last long but this was an intense match to the point that I wished they had more time to perform since it ended just went it seemed like it was going to get better. However, the real highlight to this match was when Shamrock snapped for the first time ever to the roar of the crowd.Los Boricuas vs D.O.A. An eight man tag match that was really "just there" to continue the feud between these two teams along with the Nation getting involved near the end but again, it was just there to prepare the fans for the main events.Intercontinental Champion Owen Hart vs Stone Cold Steve Austin. The stipulation here was that if Austin didn't win the title, then he would have to kiss Owen's a**. This was an outstanding wrestling match between these two as they had great chemistry in the ring to the point that Austin would later say that Owen was one of his favorites to wrestle. However, this match is mostly remembered for the infamous moment where Owen botched a piledriver that broke Austin's neck to the point where he was almost paralyzed. For those wondering, this was the beginning of the injury that lead to Austin's retirement five years later.WWF Champion The Undertaker vs Bret Hart w/Special Referee Shawn Michaels. This match had controversy written all over it with the real life tension between Bret & Shawn being evident here. Along with that, the stipulations to this match were that if Bret didn't win the title, then he would never wrestle in the United States again along with the fact that HBK couldn't show favoritism towards Taker or he would never be able to wrestle in the United States again. As for the actual match, this was an awesome wrestling match as Bret & Taker worked well together with Taker focusing on Bret's back while Bret attacked the legs of the bigger man with cameos from Paul Bearer, Brian Pillman & Owen Hart. HBK didn't become a factor till the end that lead to one of the most memorable endings in WWF history that was the birth of the Taker/Shawn feud.Overall, this event had some flops but the main matches here were more than enough to make this a quality show with the highlights being the opener, the Intercontinental title match & the main event so I would recommend this event to any wrestling fan.
Title: WWF SummerSlam 1997 VHS

reviewText: Ok you you know what this is this is a review for an old WWF Pay Per View & I am up to Summerslam 1997 I am sure you found this review randomly & wanted to find out what everybody thought of this show or you grew up during this time period of Pro Wrestling or you are interested in this time period of Pro Wrestling & didn't get to experience it for yourself. Now as always I tell the backstory leading in to the events. On The July 7th episode of RAW IS WAR Bret Hart was named The Numer 1 Contender for The WWF Championship. Bret Hart said if he doesn't win The WWF title well he will never wrestle on American Soil again. Meanwhile Shawn Michaels retrurned from his suspension & on The July 21st episode of RAW IS WAR he announced that he was going to be The Special Guest Referee for The WWF title match with Bret Hart & The Undertaker. But he also said that if he showed bias in favor of The Undertaker he would not be allowed to wrestle on American Soil ever again. Bret Hart was mad & he let Vince McMahon hear he tried to attack Vince McMahon he was pulled away. Then The Hart Foundation attacked Shawn Michaels in his dressing room. The next week on RAW IS WAR Shawn Michaels caused Bret Hart to lose to The Patriot who had just came into the company. On The July 7th episode of RAW IS WAR after being pinned in The 10 Man Tag Team Match at Canadian Stampede Stone Cold Steve Austin challenged Owen Hart for The Intercontinental Championship at Summerslam & said that he if doesn't beat Owen then he would kiss his a  s  s. Meanwhile Owen Hart & The British Bulldog won The NO 1 Contenders Tournament to face The WWF Tag Team Champions the following week on RAW IS WAR. Stone Cold defended The Tag titles by himself until Mick Foley came out & introduced The WWF to the character of Dude Love to a really big pop. Austin & Dude Love won the match & Austin even shook his hand. Now if you can't tell that Vince Russo had a helping hand in the booking for these matches then on The July 14th episode of RAW IS WAR for his European title defense against Ken Shamrock The British Bulldog said if he doesn't retain The European Championship he would eat get ready for it a can of Dog Food. On The July 28th episode of RAW IS WAR The British Bulldog challenged Ken Shamrock to a Arm Wrestling match. It looked like Ken Shamrock was going to beat The British Bulldog but Bulldog headbutted Shamrock hit him several times with a chair & made Ken Shamrock eat some Dog Food. Thesre stipulations get even better cause Brian Pillman made a wager for his match with Goldust that if he loses he will have to wear a dress until he wins antother match. Another storyline involved The Los Boricus lead by Savio Vega & his team of Jesus Castillo, Joese Estrada & Minguel Perez jr against The Disciples Of Apocalypese lead by Crush. On The July 14th episode of RAW IS WAR The Los Boricus trashed 1 of The DOA's motorcycles. The recently heel Godwins had a feud going on with The Road Warriors cause Henry Godwin blamed The Road Warriors for breaking his neck. Since nothing was solved in their match at Canadian Stampede Mankind & Hunter Hearst Helmsley this time would face each other in a Cage Match. That is the backstory leading into this event the buyrate was a 0.80 that is up from Summerslam from the year before which got a 0.58.The current champions at the time wereWWF Champion The Undertaker March 23rd 1997WWF Intercontinental Champion Owen Hart April 28th 1997WWF Europena Champion The British Bulldog February 26th 1997 match aired March 3rd 1997WWF Tag Team Champions Stone Cold Steve Austin & Dude Love May 26th 1997 Austin's original partner Shawn Michaels was suspended for 6 weeks & Austin had 6 weeks to come up with a new partner.Date August 3, 1997Attendance 20,213Venue Continental Airlines ArenaCity East Rutherford, New JerseyFree For AllThey show the history with The Hart Foundation as well as their various feuds going into This Pay Per View. Michael Cole who made his 1st apperance at a Pay Per View as an interviewer interviewed Owen Hart he said that you shouldn't worry about The Intercontinental Championship cause Stone Cold's a  s  s is on the line Bret Hart cut him off & told Michael Cole to go away.Shawn Michaels came out & he cut a promo where he said that he had no personal grudge against Bret Hart we settled that at Wrestlemania XII. He ended by saying he will be unbiased & call it right down the middle.Todd Pettengill talked to Jim Ross & asked who does he think will win The WWF title match. Ross said that if Shawn Michaels favors Undertaker then he will win & that Shawn calls it right down the middle then it will be an even match. Then Todd Pettengill asked Vince McMahon who he thinks will win The Intercontinental title match McMahon said Stone Cold maybe.Then you get to The Pay Per View where you start off with The National Anthem then you have a really good opening.Steel Cage MatchMankind Def Hunter Hearst Helmsley with Chyna *** & quarter of a starThese 2 open a Pay Per View for the 2nd time with a good match. I do enjoy where Mankind does an elbow drop off the top of the cage & homaged Jimmy Snuka. Then you had The Dude Love theme play which was great.Todd Pettengill talked to New Jersy Govenor Christie Todd Whitman who ended the tax on Pro Wrestling events in the state.Goldust with Marlena Def Brian Pillman * & 3 quarters of a staras per the stipulation Brian Pillman had to wear a dress until he won another match an ok match.The Road Warriors Hawk & Animal Def The Godwins Henry & Phinneas ** a ok match The Road Warriors who aren't technical wrestlers & The Godwins always had bad matches but this was ok  cause The LOD are fun to watch.Then they had The Million Dollar Chance Contest & nobody won although Sable & Sunny acted like a coulple ofs  l  u  ts.WWF European ChampionshipChampion The British Bulldog Def Ken Shamrock by disqualification ** 5+ for Ken Shamrock pwning anything in site.Todd Pettengill interviewed Shawn Michaels who said tonight I will be impartial & fair.Then they show a ok video package of what lead up to The Los Boricus vs Disiples Of Apocalypese match8 Man Tag Team MatchThe Los BoricusSavio VegaMingel Perez jrJesus Costillo& Jose EstradaDefThe DOACrushChainzSkull& 8 Ball* & half starsThese were the 2 worst factions in The WWF-WWE yet this was a watchable matchDuring the match Lawler said a line that made me lol. In Crush's family picture there is a court room sketch. The Nation Of Domination showed up & Ahmed Johnson Pearl River Plunged Chainz which allowed The Los Boricus to get the win.Ad shown for WWF Ground Zero In Your House.A very good video package is shown for The Owen Hart vs Stone Cold match.WWF Intercontinental ChampionshipStone Cold Steve Austin Def Champion Owen Hart **** 5+ for Austin completing the match.Had Owen Hart retained the title then Stone Cold would've had to kiss Owen's a  -  -this the match with The Sit Down Tombstone Piledriver that injured Steve Austin's neck badly & he would have problems with his neck for the next 5 & half years & it was definitley at it's worst in late 99 when he had to have neck surgery & was out for a year. This match proved how tough Austin really is Wrestlemania 13 he got over as being tough here he showed he wasn't just kayfabe tough. Plus I'm sure Austin was worried cause I am sure that Austin felt he was probably be the man for the new direction that The WWF was going in 1998.WWF ChampionshipBret Hart Def Champion The Undertaker **** & quarter of a starShawn Michaels was The Special Guest Refereehad Bret Hart lost he would never get to wrestle in The US againhad Shawn Michaels been in favor of The Undertaker then Shawn could never wrestle in The US ever again.Shawn found a chair & asksed Bret Hart if had used it Bret spit on Shawn. Shawn swung the chair at Bret but Bret dunked & Shawn hit The Undertaker accidently allowing Bret to pin Undertaker & win The WWF Championship for the 5th time. The fans showed their rage & threw trash into the ring. The Undertaker went to the back to find Shawn Michaels.So I am going to wrap this up by saying this was a solid show I thought at 1st that it was going to be Summerslam 1996 all over again with a horrible under card & the last 2 matches delievering & saving the show. But the undercard was ok The opener was good with Triple H & Mankind in a cage. Goldust & Brian Pillman was ok. A ok match with The LOD & Godwins. An ok European title match with British Bulldog & Ken Shamrock. The Los Boricus vs DOA match while mediorcore like The LOD & Godwins match was watchable. The IC & WWF title matches were great. I know I am probably overrating this show but I thought it was great 3 matche 1 was good 2 were 4 star matches & an ok undercard. I recommend this show along with King Of The Ring 97 & Canadian Stampede. These were 3 shows that were consistant & you could understand what direction The WWF was going. Next Pay Per View review will be WWF Ground Zero In Your House.
Title: WWF SummerSlam 1997 VHS

reviewText: UNDER 50: AVOID, GET A REFUND FOR YOUR TIME AND MONEY (F)50-54: PRETTY DISSAPOINTING (D)55-59: JUST AVERAGE (C)60-64: WORTH A LOOK (C+)65-69: GOOD EVENT, WORTH A BUY (B)70-74: VERY GOOD EVENT (B+)75-79: GREAT EVENT, ADD THIS TO YOUR COLLECTION NOW! (A)80+: LOCK THIS BABY IN A SAFE PLACE! (A+)STEEL CAGE MATCHTRIPLE H VS. MICK FOLEYTHIS WAS A GREAT OPENER FOR SUMMERSLAM. THIS WAS THE FIRST TIME A CAGE MATCH STARTED A PPV. THE SECOND WAS REBELLION 2001, WHICH WAS A UK PPV. GREAT BACK AND FORTH ACTION TO OPEN UP THE SHOW. MICK FOLEY IS GREAT HERE, AS HE IS WILLING TO TAKE A LOT OF PAINFUL BUMPS. THOUGH THEIR HELL IN A CELL MATCH IN 2000 IS A LITTLE BETTER, THIS IS A GREAT STEEL CAGE MATCH THAT SHOULDNT BE FORGOTTEN.WINNER: MICK FOLEYRATING: 8GOLDUST VS. BRIAN PILLMANNOT WHAT I CALL A PAY PER VIEW QUALITY MATCH, ESOACIALLY A MAJOR PPV LIKE SUMMERSLAM. THE WRESTLING WASN'T THAT BAD, AS BOTH MEN HAVE SOME SKILLS, BUT THE FEUD WAS BAD AND I WOULDNT WATCH THIS MATCH TWICE. I WONT FAIL IT, AS IT ISNT TERRIBLE, BUT THEY COULD HAVE MADE SOME IMPROVEMENTS, ESPECIALLY THE POORLY DONE ENDING.WINNER: GOLDUSTRATING: 5WWE TAG TEAM CHAMPIONSHIP MATCHLEGION OF DOOM VS. THE GODWINSI AM A FAN OF THE LOD, AND I DONT MIND WATCHING THE GODWINS IN ACTION. THIS WAS A SOLID TAG TEAM MATCH. NOTHING SPECIAL, AS IT DOES HAVE ITS SLOW POINTS, BUT WITH ITS SOLID WRESTLING, AND COOL ENDING. IT ALL MAKES FOR A DECENT TAG TEAM MATCH. BOTH TEAMS HAVE DONE BETTER, BUT ALSO WORSE, SO I CANT COMPLAIN. LOD RETAINS THE BELTS HERE.WINNER: LEGION OF DOOMRATING: 6WWE EUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIP MATCHBRITISH BULLDOG VS. KEN SHAMROCKI AM A BIG FAN OF BOTH MEN, AS THEY ALWAYS SEEM TO PUT ON GOOD MATCHES. WITH BULLDOG'S WRESTLING SKILLS, AND SHAMROCK'S UNIQUE UFC STYLE, WHAT COULD GO WRONG. WELL ONE, THEY WERE ONLY GIVEN 7 MINUTES. HOW CAN THEY SHOW HOW GREAT THEY REALLY ARE. AND TWO, A DQ ENDING. WHY END AN IMPORTANT MATCH LIKE THIS A DQ? WE STILL SAW GREAT ACTION IN THE LITTLE TIME THEY HAD TO COMPETE. I THINK IT WAS BETTER THAN THE TAG TEAM MATCH BEFORE IT, BUT IF GIVEN 10 MORE MINUTES, IT COULDVE BEEN A NEAR 5 STAR MATCH.WINNER: BRITISH BULLDOG (DQ)RATING: 7LOS BORICUAS VS. DISCYPLES OF APOCOLYPSETHIS WAS AN AVERAGE TAG TEAM MATCH. IT WASN'T THAT GOOD, BUT IT WAS STILL SOLID TAG TEAM WRESTLING. THERE IS NOTHING MUCH TO WRITE DOWN ABOUT THIS MATCH, BESIDES THE NATION OF DOMINATION INTERFERING, COSTING THE DOA A VICTORY.WINNERS: LOS BORICUASRATING: 6INTERCONTINENTAL CHAMPIONSHIPOWEN HART VS. STEVE AUSTINTHIS WAS A GREAT WRESTLING MATCH. BACK THEN, STEVE AUSTIN WAS MORE OF A TECHNICAL WRESTLER, AND A GREAT ONE TOO. WHILE OWEN IS AWESOME AS ALWAYS. THE ONLY NEGATIVE THING ABOUT THIS MATCH IS THE ENDING, WHERE AUSTIN BARELY ROLLED UP OWNE FOR THE 3. BUT IM NOT COMPLAINING, AS OWEN BOTCHED AN OWEN DRIVER, DROPPING STEVE ON THE TOP OF HIS HEAD, BREAKING HIS NECK! THAT WAS ONE SICK SPOT. I CANT LOWER THE RATING, AS AUSTIN COULD HAVE DIED FROM THAT INJURY, BUT STILL TRIES TO FINISH THE MATCH.WINNER: STEVE AUSTINRATING: 8WWE CHAMPIONSHIP MATCH SPECIAL GUEST REFEREE: SHAWN MICHAELSUNDERTAKER VS. BRET HARTTHE MATCH HAD TWO STIPULATIONS. ONE, IF BRET LOSES, HE CAN NO LONGER WRESTLE IN THE USA. AND TWO, IF MICHAELS SHOWS ANY FAVORITISM TOWARDS THE UNDERTAKER, HE CAN NO LONGER WRESTLE IN THE USA. THIS MATCH CAN BE COMPARED TO UNDERTAKER VS. KURT ANGLE, NINE YEARS LATER AT NO WAY OUT 2006. BUT IN MY OPINION THIS ONE WAS BETTER. THIS WAS A CLASSIC WRESTLING MATCH, THAT SHOULDNT BE FORGOTTEN. THIS WAS A NEAR 5 STAR MATCH, BUT NOT QUITE. STILL, ME TYPING THIS DOESNT GIVE THIS MATCH JUSTICE, YOU HAVE TO SEE IT FOR YOURSELF. THE ENDING CAME WHEN HART HIT TAKER WITH A CHAIR, HBK SEES IT, BRET SPITS IN HBK'S FACE. HBK PICKS UP THE CHAIR, SWINGS AT HART BUT MISSES, AND HITS THE UNDERTAKER! FOLLOWED BY HART GETTING THE VICTORY, AS HE DARN SURE DESERVES IT. BUT BEFORE THE MATCH BEGAN, THE CROWD WAS GIVING HART HEAT, DUE TO THE "O CANADA" SINGING, IN AN AMERICAN CROWD, BUT THAT DOESNT STOP ME FROM CHEERING FOR HIM.WINNER: BRET HARTRATING: 9WWE SUMMERSLAM 1997 - (49/70) 70%SUMMERSLAM RECIEVES AN OVERALL (B+) GRADE, MEANING IT WAS A VERY GOOD EVENT. I AGREE, WITH ONLY ONE MATCH THAT ISNT WORTH WATCHING, AND 6 DECENT TO AMAZING MATCHES, HOW CAN YOU NOT GET THIS. I RECOMMEND BUYING THIS VIDEO, ONE, FOR ITS GREAT MATCHES, AND TWO, FOR COLLECTING PURPOSES. GREAT PPV.
Title: WWF SummerSlam 1997 VHS

reviewText: FRIST THING FRIST THIS IS A SUMMERSLAM  WITH THE BEST SUPERSTARS OF 1997.THE IC TITLE WAS ON THE LINE WHEN THE LATE OWEN HART GOT BEAT BY STONE COLD STEVE AUSTIN. WHEN STONE COLD ROLLED UP OWEN HART FOR THE WIN.THIS COULD OF BEEN STEVE AUSTIN'S LAST MATCH BY LANDING ON HIS HEAD BY OWEN HART.BUT SADLY OWEN HART DIED AT OVER THE EDGE 1999.TRIPLE H VS MANKIND IN THAT CAGE MATCH WAS GREAT WHEN MANKIND TOOK A DRIVE OFF THE CAGE ONTO TRIPLE H.ONE OF THE BEST MATCHS TOOK PLACE HERE AT SUMMERSLAM 97.BRET HART BEAT THE UNDERTAKER WITH THE HELP OF SHAWN MICHAELS.THE LOOK ON SHAWN WAS WITH SNOTS AND MAD BUT HE COUNTED 1 2 3 FOR BRET HARTS FIFTH TITLE.PS GET THIS TAPE FOR ALL THREE MATCHS.
summary: SHAWN MICHAELS AS A REF AT SUMMERSLAM.
Title: WWF SummerSlam 1997 VHS

reviewText: 1997 SummerslamAugust 3, 1997Continental Airlines ArenaEast Rutherford, New JerseySteel Cage Match:Hunter Hearst Helmsley V. MankindGreat cage match and the only time a Cage Match has started a WWF Pay-Per-View (Not including the 2001 Rebellion, which isn't a Pay-Per-View). Foley bumps hardcore in this match and Triple H is his typical great self. Foley wins. ***3/4Goldust V. Brain PillmanThis feud wasn't that good and this match wasn't that good either. The botched ending really didn't help. Goldust wins. *3/4Legion Of Doom V. The GodwinnsGood match but again, not that good. The ending was good, but the other stuff was just ok. LOD win. **3/4WWF European Championship:British Bulldog (Champion) V. Ken ShamrockIntense match. However, the match was way too short for my liking. Bulldog wins by DQ. ***Los Boricuas V. DOAAnother good match that wasn't that good. Wait...does that even make any sense? Anyway, The Nation come down and cost DOA the match. **3/4WWF Intercontinental Championship:Owen Hart (Champion) V. Stone Cold Steve AustinAwesome match but very scary. Owen has Austin in the Tombstone but instead does a piledriver which is very dangerous. Austin then "rolls up" Owen to win the title. ****1/4 Austin is then helped out of the Arena and taken to the hospital. Austin can't wrestle anymore because of the results from this injury.WWF Championship:Undeertaker (Champion) V. Bret HartShawn Michaels is the guest ref. Awesome match with an awesome ending. Bret hits Taker with a chair and then Shawn sees the chair in the ring and questions Bret about it and then Bret spits in Shawn's face. Shawn swings the chair and hits....Taker! Bret covers and Shawn counts the 1...2...3! ****1/2 The WWF Title is back where is belongs again with Bret Hart.Overall, a pretty good show. The opener Cage match was awesome, Hart V. Taker was a classic and Austin injury makes this event a stand out.
summary: One Of The Scariest Moments In WWF History!
Title: WWF SummerSlam 1997 VHS
